  • Colours

Colours

Eezo comes with the ability to change colours of some properties such as text, background-color and borders. The colours can also be customised in sass by changing the default values or adding more colours.

Default Colours

These are the default colours that come with eezo, they are mostly just nice defaults for general UI purposes with a slightly cool hue for greys.

The black and white colors are bot set to "nicer" shade with zero saturation. Where as the greys are slightly saturated with a cool hue. ( why? read this.)

class name hex value example
x transparent
wht #ffffff
white #f9f9f9
light #b5b8bf
grey #82848e
dark #575c67
pitch #161f23
black #1a1a1a
blk #000000

Extra Colours

The extra colours are just some "pretty OK" colours to jump-start your ui. They only come with the Core+ bundle and can be easily overridden with customisation in sass.

class name hex value example
silver #dde3e6
gold #c7aa5c
yellow #d6d01e
orange #d66a1e
red #d61e40
pink #ec2666
violet #981bd8
purple #5930d6
blue #1e9bd6
teal #17b5b5
mint #31e894
green #1ed668

Background Colours

Background colours can be applied to any valid html element with the class: `bg-x` where "x" is replaced with the desired colour. Eg: 

<body class="bg-white">
  has a white background.
</body>
.bg-xtransparent
.bg-blk#000000
.bg-black#1a1a1a
.bg-pitch#161f23
.bg-dark#575c67
.bg-grey#82848e
.bg-light#b5b8bf
.bg-white#f9f9f9
.bg-wht#ffffff
.bg-silver#dde3e6
.bg-gold#c7aa5c
.bg-yellow#d6d01e
.bg-orange#d66a1e
.bg-red#d61e40
.bg-pink#ec2666
.bg-violet#981bd8
.bg-purple#5930d6
.bg-blue#1e9bd6
.bg-teal#17b5b5
.bg-mint#31e894
.bg-green#1ed668
